title: Need an ace to win big? Even with large pockets, Mets refuse to overpay
content: Whether it's in free agency or at the trade deadline, David Stearns isn't compromising on his starting pitching philosophy.

title: Can loading up on relievers at the deadline win you a World Series? We found out
content: Contenders went all-in for relievers at this year's deadline. Here's how much bullpens really help in October.

title: ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: Panthers' Horn misses practice after car accident
content: Panthers CB Jaycee Horn was involved in a car accident Wednesday morning and will not participate in Carolina's joint practice session against the Browns in Charlotte.

title: Sex toy tossed on Sparks' court, lands near player
content: A sex toy landed near Indiana's Sophie Cunningham after it was thrown from the stands in Los Angeles while the Fever played the Sparks on Tuesday night, the latest such incident to interrupt a WNBA game in the past seven days.

title: Gurriel makes history with HR off 103.9 mph pitch
content: Arizona outfielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. crushed a 103.9 mph fastball from San Diego's Mason Miller into the left-field seats for a two-run homer in the eighth inning Tuesday night, the hardest-hit pitch for a homer since MLB started pitch tracking in 2008.

title: ESPN joins with WWE; to stream WrestleMania
content: WrestleMania will be part of ESPN's new direct-to-consumer streaming service, starting in 2026, thanks to an agreement between WWE and ESPN.

title: Venus on playing in 2026: Don't ever rule me out
content: Former world No. 1 and seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams said she was uncertain about her future beyond the upcoming US Open but teased she wasn't done with the sport just yet.

title: 49ers TE Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: 📸 Bulls bring back Jordan-era pinstripe uniform
content: Jordan and the Bulls first wore the threads during the 1995-96 campaign when the team went 72-10 and won a championship.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's final season at LSU is a family affair
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: 'Steal reps' and 'losing ground': How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: 20 sophomore NFL defenders who could stand out this season -- and what makes each player so special
content: Let's take a closer look at 20 intriguing second-year defensive players, including Quinyon Mitchell, Cooper DeJean, Jared Verse and Edgerrin Cooper.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without stars.

title: NFL draft prospects with the most at stake this season: Who can make a statement in 2025?
content: Which players' draft stocks have the most riding on the 2025 college football season? We picked out 10, including three quarterbacks.

title: Keith Tkachuk on Matthew, Brady, Olympic gold and his Hall of Fame snub
content: "There's nothing better than seeing your kids do what they love to do best," Tkachuk said of his All-Star sons.

title: 2025 SEC football preview: Power Rankings, top players, must-see games
content: Our college football experts breakdown preseason SEC Power Rankings, plus games and players to watch this fall.

title: How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Clippers' Harden surprised with court reveal, design on China tour
content: A basketball court with a larger-than-life image of James Harden was revealed in Guangzhou, China, on Monday.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League preview: Chelsea to contend? Will Man United rebound?
content: Ian Darke goes team-by-team to set up the 2025-26 Premier League season. Which clubs have improved this summer, and who could be in danger of relegation?

title: LaLiga's top 2025-26 kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atlético, more
content: The season starts next week (stream every match live on ESPN+), so let's take a look at what teams are wearing.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United tracking Fiorentina's Comuzzo
content: Fiorentina center back Pietro Comuzzo is being watched by Manchester United, Bournemouth and Sunderland. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Top 'Drumbeat' players: Bo Nix, Omarion Hampton among those generating buzz
content: Six potential league-winning players who are generating serious excitement in fantasy circles as the season draws closer.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Uttarkashi Cloudburst Highlights: 190 People Rescued From Uttarkashi's Dharali Village, Says Chief Minister
content: Uttarkashi Cloudburst: A cloudburst struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Tuesday afternoon which triggered a mudslide and flash floods in Dharali village.

title: Melting Glaciers, Fragile Slopes, Human Hubris: What Led To Uttarakhand's Tragedy
content: Five dead, dozens missing. Was it a cloudburst or a glacial lake outburst? Experts say the Uttarakhand flash floods reflect the escalating impact of climate change on the Himalayas.

title: Aviation Safety Body Directs Increased Security At Airports Due To Potential Terror Threat
content: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has directed all stakeholders to enhance security at airports due to a potential threat from a terror group during the period from September 22 to October 2.

title: Hyderabad Psychologist Marries Patient, Dies By Suicide Over Alleged Harassment
content: A 33-year-old psychologist died by suicide on Tuesday allegedly after she was harassed by her husband and his family in Hyderabad, police said.

title: "India Doing Very Well": RBI Governor On Trump's "Dead Economy" Jibe
content: The Indian economy is "doing very well" and contributing more to global growth than the US, Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra said on Wednesday, days after US President Donald Trump's remark of India being a dead economy.

title: "Unfair, Unjustified, Unreasonable": Centre On Trump's 50% Tariff On India
content: India has made it clear that it stands firm on its national interests after US President Donald Trump's move to impose another 25 per cent tariff over the import of Russian oil.

title: Hyderabad's 'RRR' To Be Upgraded To 6-Lane To Meet Traffic Demands
content: Telangana's Minister for Roads and Buildings, Komatireddy Venkat Reddy, announced that the state has proposed to upgrade the planned Regional Ring Road (RRR) around Hyderabad from four lanes to six lanes.

title: Trump Imposes Additional 25% Tariff On India, Total Goes Up To 50%
content: Donald Trump announced an extra 25 per cent tariff on India Wednesday night as 'penalty' for the continued import of Russian crude oil, and vowed similar measures against other countries that buy, directly or indirectly, from Moscow.

title: Suicide Or Murder? Assam Woman Dies Of Burn Injuries, Husband Arrested
content: A woman died of severe burn injuries in Assam's Tezpur today. Her family claimed the 42-year-old woman was set on fire by her husband. The 45-year-old man was arrested from Pahumara Chuburi in Sonitpur district, where the incident took place.

title: Trump India Tariffs 2025 Live Updates: Trump Doubles Tariff On India To 50%, Centre Responds
content: US President Donald Trump today announced 25 per more tariffs on India as "punishment" for buying oil from Russia, taking the total tariffs to 50 per cent.

title: Actor Vijay Deverakonda Questioned, Says Even ED Officials Did Not Why
content: After four hours of questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in Hyderabad, Tollywood actor Vijay Deverakonda has said that even those who had questioned him did not know why his name had come up in the case.

title: Is India Facing Highest Trump Tariff? Breaking Down The Latest US Order
content: US President Donald Trump today signed an executive order imposing an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, citing New Delhi's continued purchase of Russian oil -- a revenue source the White House says is sustaining Moscow's war in Ukraine.

title: Top Court Orders Probe Into Illegal Construction At Odisha's Satkosia Tiger Reserve
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued notices to the Union government, the Central Empowered Committee (CEC), among others, for construction and tourism projects within and around Odisha's Satkosia Tiger Reserve violating environmental norms.

title: Pakistan Misses 3 Out Of 5 IMF Targets Before 2nd Review Of $7 Billion Loan
content: Pakistan has missed three out of the five targets set by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for the second review of the USD 7 billion bailout package, a media report said on Wednesday.

title: 2 Appointments For Same Post In A Day Sparks Devendra Fadnavis-Eknath Shinde Rift Buzz
content: A fresh flashpoint has emerged between Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and his deputy Eknath Shinde, this time over the appointment of the General Manager of the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST).

title: M Kharge's Jagdeep Dhankhar Reference To Push For Debate On Bihar Voter List
content: Quoting former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar that "anything can be discussed in the House", the INDIA bloc, led by Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, on Wednesday demanded an urgent debate in Parliament on the Bihar voter roll revision exercise.

title: Trump Raises Tariffs To 50%: What It Means For India
content: US President Donald Trump today announced an additional 25 per cent tariff on goods coming from India as penalty for what he called New Delhi's continued buying of Russian oil.

title: 100-Metre Iron Bridge Destroyed By Floods, 12 Villages Cut Off In Uttarkashi
content: The impact of the flash floods in Uttarkashi is being felt across the region and there are spots were rescue teams have not been able to reach yet.

title: Trump Doubles Tariff On India To 50%: Full Text Of Order
content: US President Donald Trump today issued an executive order imposing an additional 25 percent tariff on goods from India, days after he issued a threat to New Delhi over its purchase of oil from Russia.

title: Akasa Air Examiner Suspended For Lapse In Checking Pilot Skills
content: Akasa Air's examiner has been suspended by the civil aviation regulator DGCA over procedural lapses during pilot skill test.

title: EC bonded labour of BJP, won’t allow any action against State govt. officers: Mamata
content: On August 5, the EC had sent a letter to the State Chief Secretary informing about the suspension of four government officials of the State for irregularities in the registration of names in the voter list

title: ‘No ground’ for case against Adoor, Kerala Police get legal opinion
content: However, several activists have signalled that they will move criminal miscellaneous petitions in  magistrate’s court demanding his prosecution.

title: SFI wins Kannur University union polls for 26th year in a row
content: SFI accuses rivals of rigging and illegal entry; KSU–MSF blames SFI for abducting a university union councillor

title: MP appeals to MEA for repatriation of stranded Kakinada fishermen
content: The group of fishermen were caught by Sri Lanka on August 4 after they entered into Sri Lankan waters on their boat.

title: Pinarayi Vijayan to hand over keys to 332 flats constructed for fisherfolk at Muttathara on August 7
content: The flats are part of the first phase of a 400-flat housing complex envisaged to rehabilitate fisherfolk displaced by recurring sea surges and erosion

title: SC begins hearing pleas of women Army officers denied permanent commissions
content: Women officers with short service commissions blame “systematic discrimination” in annual confidential reports and denial of equal opportunities, resulting in denial of permanent commissions

title: Woman drives her dream with KSRTC at Ponnani
content: Arya Nanda credits the KSRTC for opening the driving school’s doors to women, paving the way for a new generation of female drivers

title: Kalyana Karnataka Horata Samiti to present memorandum to Govind Rao Committee
content: The memorandum contains various aspects for consideration and inclusion in a report to be submitted by the Govind Rao Committee

title: Fishing gear a major source of ‘microplastic’ contamination along Indian coasts
content: Minister Jitendra Singh shares findings from surveys conducted by Ministry of Earth Sciences through  the National Centre for Coastal Research

title: Injured worker dies weeks after Gujarat bridge collapse, toll now 22
content: Following the tragedy, four engineers from the State’s Roads and Buildings Department were suspended for alleged negligence

title: Official apathy delays Central aid to families of Pettimudy landslip victims
content: Devikulam taluk officials have not submitted the necessary details to the  District Disaster Management Authority, delaying the aid, say DDMA sources. Kin say they have already submitted all the required details to the taluk office

title: Khandre says skill development for journalists, especially those in rural areas, is important
content: He inaugurates workshop for journalists from Kalyana Karnataka region organised by the Karnataka Media Academy in Bidar

title: Ambergris worth ₹2 crore seized in Ahmedabad; one held
content: Ahmedabad City Crime Branch arrests suspect; contraband linked to Mumbai-based associate still absconding

title: Govt. committed to transforming Andhra Pradesh into skill hub for solar and wind energy companies: Lokesh
content: Government to launch Naipunyam skill portal on September 1, aims at equipping youth with industry-relevant skills particularly in emerging sectors like the green and renewable energies

title: Deputy Mayor inaugurates renovated Aristo Road amid LDF boycott
content: The LDF leadership of the Thrissur Corporation council, including the Mayor and Standing Committee Chairman, abstained from the event. Deputy Mayor says infrastructure projects should not become battlegrounds for party politics

title: ‘Seeds of communal poison sown by RSS, BJP’ blamed for poisoning drinking water in school
content: Minister Priyank Kharge asks whether people who poison children for getting a headmaster transferred can be called human beings

title: Global workshop on research potential of Hortus Malabaricus from Aug. 9
content: Workshop will bring together researchers, academicians, and policymakers to explore the relevance of the plants documented in the monumental 17th Century botanical treatise

title: Midway into monsoon season, Kerala yet to revise ‘orange book’
content: An updated handbook has to be released ahead of every monsoon including the lessons learnt from the previous season. After last year’s catastrophic landslides in Wayanad, the govt. it yet to put in place a protocol for response to such situations

title: 30 girls of Gurukul school fall ill with diarrhoea in Nellore district
content: Two students are currently availing treatment at ICU of Nellore GGH, while the parents of other students have taken them to their homes, informs hospital superintendent

title: Omar seeks restoration of J&K’s Statehood, calls for ‘course correction’
content: In a letter to political parties, the J&K Chief Minister wrote, “essential course correction prevents us from sliding down a dangerous and slippery slope where the Statehood of our constituent States is no longer regarded as a foundational and sacred constitutional right”

title: Cabinet approves free bus ride for women in Andhra Pradesh from August 15
content: Under the ‘Stree Shakti’ initiative, which is one of the Super Six election promises, over 2.6 crore women, girl students, and transgender individuals can travel free of cost on APSRTC buses; Cabinet also approves ₹648.59 crore relief package for weavers, besides giving its nod to 150–200 units of free electricity for 40,808 hair-cutting saloons

title: Kerala Cabinet gives approval for MEDISEP Phase 2
content: Basic cover will be enhanced to ₹5 lakh. Nod for recommendation that MEDISEP be extended to employees and pensioners in PSUs, corporations, autonomous and statutory bodies and cooperative sector

title: Annamayya SP tells public to exercise caution against digital frauds
content: Expresses serious concern at cybercriminals resorting to advanced technologies, becoming dexterous in exploiting unsuspecting members of the public through a variety of offences

title: New species of rain snake recorded in Mizoram
content: The narrow-banded rain snake is the third species in the genus Smithophis to have been recorded from the northeastern State

title: India has witnessed transparent, sensitive governance model in last 11 years: PM Modi
content: The government's administrative machinery for decades ran from British-era buildings, where the working conditions were poor and marked by inadequate space, light and ventilation, he said

title: Surging coconut oil prices leave Kerala Ayurvedic drug manufacturers in a fix
content: Ayurvedic medicine manufacturers’ body seeks the government’s intervention to provide subsidised oil for drug production

title: Heavy rain likely in Rayalaseema until August 10, says IMD
content: Light to moderate rain is likely in North and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh regions during the period, it says, and forecasts above-normal rainfall in most parts of the State in August and September

title: Collector, SP call for strict enforcement of child protection measures in Chittoor district
content: Sumit Kumar highlights the need for intensified sensitisation drives at all vulnerable areas to spread the message of ‘Beti Bachao Beti Padhao’

title: K-RIDE to finally get full-time MD after gap of nearly three years
content: The position of full-time MD at K-RIDE has remained vacant since 2021. Since then, various IAS officers have been handling the post as an additional responsibility

title: SC orders end of ‘inhuman’ hand-pulled rickshaws in Maharashtra's Matheran
content: The top court referred to a 45-year-old judgement in the "Azad Rickshaw Pullers Union v. State of Punjab" case which held cycle-rickshaws were inconsistent with the preamble’s pledge of social justice

title: NTCA highlights salary delays, staff shortage in its probe into M.M. Hills tiger deaths
content: Though the NTCA has not attributed the death of tigers to these issues, it has mentioned that inadequate allotment of funds and delay in their release as one of the weaknesses plaguing MM Hills reserve

title: Regional IFFK to kick off in Kozhikode on August 8
content: The much-awaited four-day event will conclude on August 11 with screenings at Kairali, Sree, and Coronation cinemas

title: Trump doubles tariff on India to 50% for buying Russian oil; MEA says will ‘protect national interest’
content: 25% tariff from Thursday, additional 25% after 21 days; “unfair, unjustified and unreasonable”, says MEA, adds India will protect its national interest; almost 55% of Indian exports to U.S. will be directly affected, says FIEO

title: Thadou tribe leaders, Meitei groups meet to pursue peace in Manipur
content: This was the first time that members of the tribe stepped into the Meitei-dominated Imphal Valley after the ethnic conflict began in May 2023

title: ‘Untouchability wall’ in Karur denies SC residents free access to other areas
content: However, the caste Hindus strongly deny their allegations. They allege that “some outsiders” have been trying to create caste clashes with an ulterior motive

title: Jagan should own up responsibility for liquor scam in Andhra Pradesh, says TDP leader Anam Venkataramana Reddy
content: How can the former Chief Minister feign ignorance in spite of having close links with the main accused in the case, he questions; the YSRCP dispensation sold substandard liquor and barred digital payments at liquor outlets, he alleges

title: Closure of Jan Aushadi Kendras: Karnataka’s Health Minister justifies move, says it is to ensure free medicines
content: Gundu Rao urged Nadda to direct PMBI to supply medicines to Karnataka’s Health Department at the same rates offered to Jan Aushadi Kendras

title: Crisis looms for KTU with finance committee meeting adjourned due to lack of quorum
content: The meeting, called by V-C in-charge M. Sivaprasad, was crucial for the passage of the budget. The university’s financial transactions have been disrupted, leading to a near-complete standstill of its daily operations

title: Karnataka High Court stays proceedings against Minister K.J. George and two bureaucrats on complaint of illegalities in smart meter tender process
content: The High Court of Karnataka on Wednesday stayed the proceedings before a special court against Energy Minister K.J. George and two officials on a private complaint lodged by BJP leaders alleging a series of illegalities and corruption in awarding tender in favour of a private company to supply smart electricity meters at an exorbitant price

title: Slew of initiatives for ST department’s  golden jubilee celebrations
content: As part of the initiatives, ‘En Ooru’ tribal village project will be scaled up as a full-fledged ethnic tourism initiative, utilising all possibilities of Responsible Tourism and thus preserving tribal culture

title: Provide best medical services to those visiting PHCs: Nandyal Collector
content: People visit government hospitals with a belief that quality medical care would be available, says Rajakumari Ganiya, asking staff to meet their expectations

title: 'Attempt to blackmail India': Rahul on Trump's extra 25% tariff; targets PM
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized US President Trump's increased tariffs on India as "economic blackmail" to force an unfair trade deal. He alleged PM Modi's silence on the issue stems from a US investigation into Adani and potential exposure of financial links. India defended its right to pursue energy policies based on national interest amidst the tariff threats.

title: 50% US duty on India: Trump threatens more tariff; leaves door open for talks
content: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on India due to its continued purchase of Russian crude oil, despite prior warnings. Trump stated India is 'fuelling the war machine' and expressed dissatisfaction with the trade relationship. India's foreign ministry has defended its position, citing national interests and accusing the US and EU of hypocrisy in their own dealings with Russia.

title: Trump’s tariff treasure: US 'taking in so much money' – but where is it going?
content: US President Trump touts billions in tariff revenue, but its use remains unclear. While the government collected nearly $30 billion last month alone, a 242% increase, the funds enter a general Treasury pool. Trump proposed debt reduction or rebates, yet neither materialized.

title: Mohammed Siraj's classy reply to Owaisi's viral 'poora khol' comment
content: India defeated England by six runs in the final Test, leveling the series. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets, earning praise from Asaduddin Owaisi. Siraj was named Player of the Match. Shubman Gill captained the team after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's retirements. Gill also received the Player of the Series award.

title: Microsoft is planning stricter 'Return To Office' policy, requiring employees to ...
content: Microsoft is considering a stricter 'Return to Office' policy, potentially requiring Redmond employees to work from the office at least three days a week starting January 2026. This shift marks a change from their flexible hybrid model, aligning Microsoft with companies like Amazon and Dell.

title: Helicopter crash in Ghana: 8 killed; defence, environment ministers among dead
content: A devastating helicopter crash in Ghana has claimed the lives of eight individuals, including two prominent government ministers: the defence minister and the environment minister. The helicopter, en route to a gold-mining region, lost contact before the tragic incident. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of this national tragedy, marking one of Ghana's worst aviation disasters in recent years.

title: Elon Musk responds to shareholders' lawsuit: ‘They are scum of the Earth. The worst….’
content: Tesla shareholders have filed a lawsuit accusing Elon Musk and the company of securities fraud, alleging they concealed safety risks associated with Tesla's self-driving technology, including the Robotaxi. Musk responded on X, dismissing the lawsuit as driven by opportunistic class-action lawyers. The lawsuit seeks damages for investors, claiming Tesla exaggerated autonomous driving capabilities, leading to inflated stock value.

title: Shubman Gill's full list of records from the England series
content: Shubman Gill's stellar performance led India to a 2-2 series draw in England, despite the absence of key players. Gill amassed 774 runs, averaging 75.40, with four centuries. His remarkable scores included a high of 269 at Edgbaston.

title: 'Direction of nation will be decided from here': What PM Modi said at Kartavya Bhawan
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the first Kartavya Bhavan at Kartavya Path in Delhi, marking a significant step towards a developed India. He emphasized that the building symbolizes India's transformation and will be a hub for shaping policies for a 'Viksit Bharat'. The new complex aims to modernize administrative infrastructure, fostering collaboration among ministries and saving approximately Rs 1,500 crore annually.

title: SC to ECI: Explain 65L missing Bihar voters; ADR questions mass deletions
content: The Supreme Court has directed the election commission of India (ECI) to provide detailed information by August 9 regarding the removal of approximately 65 lakh voters from Bihar's draft electoral rolls. This directive follows a plea by an NGO seeking clarity on the reasons for these deletions, whether due to death, relocation, or other factors.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's Job Offer; Zuckerberg launched a full-scale …
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: PM Modi likely to visit China: First trip to Beijing since 2020 Galwan clash
content: Narendra Modi will visit China for the SCO Summit. This is his first visit since the Galwan clash. The visit happens amid trade issues with the United States. Donald Trump threatens higher tariffs on India. India defends its energy strategy. Ajit Doval is in Moscow for talks on strategic partnership. Discussions will include Russian oil supplies to India.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan 2025: Wishes, quotes, images, gIFs & messages
content: Raksha Bandhan, a Hindu festival, celebrates the bond between siblings. Sisters tie Rakhi on their brother's wrist. This signifies love and protection. The article provides messages, quotes, and wishes for Raksha Bandhan 2025. It includes images and GIFs for the festival. The content focuses on expressing love and strengthening sibling relationships. It shares greetings for a joyous celebration.

title: 'Castle Dracula': Inside Epstein's mansion where Trump dined and Chomsky wrote
content: It had all the trappings of wealth—heated sidewalks, a taxidermied tiger, seven floors of Versailles-by-way-of-psychodrama—and yet its most valuable commodity wasn’t luxury. It was leverage. Because Epstein didn’t just collect art or investments. He collected people.

title: Trump, Gretzky and Tkachuk to revive youth Presidential Fitness Test
content: Donald Trump's President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition includes Wayne Gretzky and Matthew Tkachuk. The Council will focus on fitness in schools. It aims to restore college athletic customs and protect women's sports. Matthew Tkachuk impressed the White House during the Florida Panthers' visit. He will help shape fitness programs for kids.

title: Marner trade rocks Leafs; buzz grows around possible Nick Robertson deal
content: Toronto Maple Leafs are in turmoil after trading Mitch Marner to Vegas Golden Knights. Nicolas Roy joined the Leafs. Nick Robertson is now a potential trade target, with Pittsburgh showing interest. Kyle Dubas, now with Pittsburgh, drafted Robertson. Robertson's future with the Leafs is uncertain. The team must decide if he is a long-term asset or a trade piece.

title: Magic Johnson praises Trinity Rodman for her latest achievement
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: Gemini vs Grok vs Claude vs DeepSeek: Which AI tool is best for chess?
content: Google's Kaggle Game Arena witnessed a thrilling start as Gemini 2.5 Pro, o4-mini, Grok 4, and o3 secured dominant victories in the AI chess exhibition tournament. These LLMs defeated formidable opponents, showcasing their strategic capabilities. Grok 4's impressive performance drew attention, with Elon Musk acknowledging xAI's minimal focus on chess.

title: Trump a Bihari? Fake certificate names US prez as Samastipur local
content: A bizarre incident in Bihar's Samastipur district has emerged during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, where an online application was filed claiming US President Donald Trump as a resident. The application included Trump's photo and his parents' names. Authorities rejected it and filed an FIR.

title: 'India contributes more than US': RBI guv on Trump's 'dead economy' jab
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra refuted Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark, asserting India's strong economic performance and significant contribution to global growth, exceeding that of the United States. Despite concerns over potential US tariffs due to India's energy ties with Russia, Malhotra assured a stable inflation outlook, with authorities prepared to intervene if global oil prices rise to protect consumers.

title: Scooter DKS rode has Rs 18,500 in fines; owner pays Rs 1K after viral ride
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar faced scrutiny after riding a scooter with ₹18,500 in unpaid traffic fines during a Hebbal flyover inspection. The JD(S) party highlighted the pending fines and questioned the legality of the half-helmets worn by Shivakumar and his companion.

title: Hulk Hogan’s death: Cops address foul play concerns in WWE icon’s sudden death
content: Following Hulk Hogan's sudden death from cardiac arrest, his daughter Brooke Hogan speculated about foul play, citing concerns over improper medication and privacy violations by medical staff. Despite these concerns and the absence of an autopsy, Clearwater Police Department found no evidence of foul play.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Prasidh's coach: 'He played into England's hands initially, pulled off a 3-card trick later'
content: Prasidh Krishna's impressive comeback in the fifth Test against England, where he claimed eight wickets, played a crucial role in India's victory. After facing criticism and being dropped, Krishna refined his approach, displaying improved consistency and tactical awareness. His performance offers India confidence in his potential for Test matches, particularly in SENA countries, despite likely limited opportunities at home.

title: Will 'Paatal Lok' star Jaideep Ahlawat play cricketer Nitish Rana in his biopic?
content: Indian cricketer Nitish Rana expressed his desire for Jaideep Ahlawat to portray him in a biopic, citing their shared Jaat heritage and Ahlawat's Haryanvi speaking ability. Rana, known for his street-style fashion, revealed that he adopted his ponytail from Shah Rukh Khan.

title: Love beets, but worried about kidney health? Here's how to prevent kidney stone risk
content: Beets, a nutritional powerhouse, offer numerous health benefits but concern kidney stone sufferers due to their high oxalate content. Experts suggest boiling or fermenting beets to reduce oxalate levels significantly. Pairing them with calcium-rich foods like yogurt aids oxalate binding in the gut, preventing kidney stone formation.

title: Uttarakhand floods: 11 Army jawans missing; rescue ops underway
content: A cloudburst near Harsil in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered a flash flood, leaving 11 Indian Army jawans missing. Rescue teams, including the NDRF and Army personnel, are working tirelessly in challenging conditions to locate the missing soldiers. The area is isolated due to road breaches and a collapsed bridge, complicating relief efforts.

title: Watch: School ditches 'backbencher' setup; inspired by Malayalam film
content: Govt. High School, Dongargaon in Burhanpur district, Madhya Pradesh, has pioneered a 'U-shape' seating arrangement, inspired by Kerala, to eliminate the concept of 'backbenchers.' Principal Jagdish Patil's initiative fosters dialogue, inclusivity, and leadership by positioning students face-to-face with the teacher. Following its success in Class 10, Class 9 students requested the same arrangement, drawing interest from other district schools.

title: 'Poo bani Parwati': Anaya Bangar wears mom's saree, recreates iconic Kareena Kapoor moment from K3G
content: Anaya Bangar, daughter of former Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar, recently shared photos on Instagram dressed in a saree, referencing Kareena Kapoor's iconic 'Poo bani Parwati' look. Anaya, who underwent gender affirmation surgery, previously spoke about the “toxic masculinity” prevalent in cricket.

title: Bengali row: Mamata leads rally; attacks Centre over NRC, voter list revision
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee spearheaded a massive protest rally in Jhargram, condemning alleged attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants and accusing the BJP of orchestrating a campaign of harassment. Banerjee vowed to expose the BJP if attacks on Bengali language and people continue, asserting that Bengali identity will not be silenced.

title: 'It just arrives': The violent rhythm of Dharali's Kheer Gad; history of floods, absence of safety
content: Dharali, near Gangotri, faces recurrent floods from the Kheer Gad river, turning disaster into a seasonal norm. Villagers brace for the river's sudden surges, marking years by flood events rather than festivals. Despite past incidents causing significant damage to homes and livelihoods, no lives were lost between 2010 and 2018.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Fans react to Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect'
content: Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect' ignited fan speculation. KL Rahul shared an adorable photo of his daughter, Evaarah, holding his finger, melting hearts online. Khushboo Patani, Disha's sister, threatened legal action against trolls spreading misinformation. Yuzvendra Chahal congratulated RJ Mahvash, dismissing dating rumors. Mukesh Khanna defended Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win, emphasizing his deserving dedication to cinema.

title: 'That mentality ... ': Sacked by BCCI, ex-India coach finally breaks silence on KKR return
content: Abhishek Nayar, after his departure from the Indian cricket team's coaching staff, has rejoined Kolkata Knight Riders as a mentor in the IPL. He's also taken on a mentorship role with the UP Warriorz in the WPL, aiming to cultivate a winning culture. Nayar highlighted the significant progress in women's cricket, noting the increased power and athleticism in the game.

title: ‘Phansi Ghar’ row: Atishi evicted from Delhi assembly; AAP seeks ASI survey
content: Delhi Assembly witnessed a tumultuous session as AAP MLAs, including Atishi, were marshalled out following a dispute with BJP members over the authenticity of a structure on the premises. The BJP claims the renovated site, inaugurated as a British-era execution chamber, was actually a tiffin room, accusing the AAP government of historical manipulation.

title: Kerala house of horror: Over 10 burnt bones, skull, tooth found in man’s house
content: Police searched C M Sebastian's property in Alappuzha regarding Jainamma's disappearance. They found skeletal pieces, a bag, and cloth. A pond was drained, and a septic tank inspected. Ground-penetrating radar and a cadaver dog were used. Sebastian admitted knowing the missing women and having financial dealings. He hasn't revealed what happened to them. The investigation continues to find more evidence.

title: Bihar SIR row: Kharge seeks discussion in RS; writes to Deputy Chairman
content: Mallikarjun Kharge has urged the Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman to allow a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, emphasizing its critical importance to voters, especially those from weaker sections. He referenced a past ruling affirming the House's right to discuss matters of fundamental democratic importance like electoral roll revisions.

title: 'Just a coincidence': Tendulkar on India winning without Bumrah
content: Sachin Tendulkar believes India's Test wins without Jasprit Bumrah were coincidental, emphasizing Bumrah's "exceptional" quality. Despite Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance, Bumrah remains a top performer. Tendulkar also lauded Washington Sundar's all-round contributions and defended India's decision to play on during the Manchester Test, supporting the team's spirit and dismissing concerns about England's bowlers needing rest before the final Test.

title: Watch: Karni Sena worker tries to slap Swami Maurya in Fatehpur; arrested
content: In Fatehpur, Swami Prasad Maurya faced an attack. A Karni Sena worker, disguised as a supporter, slapped him during a welcome ceremony. The attacker blended into the crowd. Police are investigating the incident and the attacker's motive. Maurya has been in the news for controversial remarks on Hinduism. His comments have sparked outrage among Hindu groups.

title: Kartavya Bhawan inaugurated; key things to know about high-tech building
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first building under the Common Central Secretariat project, designed to consolidate government offices for improved efficiency. Key ministries, including Home Affairs and External Affairs, will relocate from Raisina Hills to this modern, energy-efficient complex. The broader Central Vista redevelopment aims to modernize government infrastructure and consolidate operations by June 2027.

title: Gabrielle union says menopause made motherhood harder, more emotional
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Two tremors strike region within hours; no damage reported so far
content: Afghanistan was struck by a 4.4 magnitude earthquake on Wednesday at a depth of 155 kilometers, following a 4.2 magnitude quake earlier in the day. This seismic activity is part of a series of recent earthquakes in the region, including a 5.5 magnitude quake on August 2.

title: 'Another Pak diplomat quits': Army recalls 1971 war 'build-up'; highlights it in 'this day that year' post
content: The Army revisits the 1971 war with Pakistan. Newspaper clippings from 1971 show Pakistan's military buildup. They also highlight unrest in then-East Pakistan. The US backed Pakistan during the war. This reminder follows India's rejection of US criticism over energy trade with Russia. Tensions between India and Pakistan are currently high after a terror attack.

title: 'Irresponsible statements': BJP to file contempt petition against Priyanka's SC remarks
content: The BJP plans to file a contempt of court petition against Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her remarks defending Rahul Gandhi after the Supreme Court criticized his comments during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. BJP MP Manan Kumar Mishra deemed her statements "irresponsible.

title: WR Allen returns to Chargers, home for 11 years
content: WR keenan Allen returns to the Chargers, home for 11 years . he spent the first 11 years of his NFL career with the chargers . the 33-year-old will reunite with quarterback Justin Herbert . we have reporters with all 32 teams, covering the ins and outs of camp .

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Why revenue sharing is priority No. 1 and whether a lockout is realistic
content: no deal in place ahead of the current collective bargaining agreement expiring on Oct. 31 . players described meeting with commissioner Cathy Engelbert and ownership representative in Indianapolis as "a missed opportunity" players wore "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirts during warmups .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Rams' Davante Adams 'outstanding' in practice vs. Cowboys
content: the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . we have updated all 32 files often with the latest details . who are the breakouts to watch , especially for fantasy football?
